ExampleDefinition.Description:
This 3D Chart demo shows how to add a custom Cube Geometry to the SciChart3DSurface using our [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Primitives.BaseSceneEntity%601.html']BaseSceneEntity type[/url]
Entities may be added to the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.IViewport3D~RootEntity.html']SciChart3DSurface.Viewport3D.RootEntity[/url], which is a type of [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Primitives.BaseSceneEntity.html']BaseSceneEntity[/url]. Several cubes are created and added to the scene. Some are transparent, some are opaque. Internally SciChart uses order-independent transparency algorithm to draw entities back to front so that transparency appears correctly to the user. To denote an entity as transparent, you must override [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Primitives.BaseSceneEntity~IsTransparent.html']BaseSceneEntity.IsTransparent()[/url]
We also use the same example to demonstrate drawing 3D Text at specific locations in the 3D scene. This uses the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Visuals.Primitives.Font3D.html']Font3D[/url] type and again [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Primitives.BaseSceneEntity.html']BaseSceneEntity[/url] to custom draw text of a specific font, color and string in the 3D scene.
Besides, the example demonstrates how to use the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Coordinates%20in%203D%20Space.html']Coordinate Transformation API[/url] in SciChart 3D
